ZT2Strings.LOC_STRING: Welcome to Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania! In this tutorial, you learn how to build a basic exhibit tank, change its biome, add marine animals, install a water filter, and more. When you're ready to start, click the Check button.
Construction Panel
Let's build a tank! Click the Construction button.
null
Tank Building
Click the Tank Building tab.

Building tank walls is a lot like building fences. There are three basic tank wall modes -- Freeform Tank Placement, Rectangular Tank Placement, and Octagonal Tank Placement. Unlike fences, you start in Rectangular Tank Placement mode by default. Click the Check button to continue.
Acrylic Tank Wall
Click the acrylic tank wall icon to select it.
null
Tank Building

See the large rectangle outlined in the dirt at the end of the path? You're going to place your tank there. First click on the acrylic tank wall icon on the Tank Building panel. Next click the upper left corner of the rectangle near the fountain to anchor one corner of the tank. Drag the cursor to the lower right corner, near the flower bed. When the acrylic tank fully covers the rectangle outlined in the dirt, click to place the tank.
Well done! Note that when you build a tank, everything inside the tank is recycled--even buildings. Now let's add a tank entrance and a donation box. Click the Check button to continue.
Tank Entrance

Rectangular Tank Placement mode automatically prompts you to place a tank entrance and donation box after building a tank. Notice a tank entrance on your cursor? To add an entrance, point to the location on the tank wall where you want the entrance to go. Click to place your tank entrance.
Since zookeepers and trainers can't enter a tank without a tank entrance, always place a tank entrance on a tank wall after you build a tank. Click the Check button to continue.
Donation Box
It's always a good idea to place a donation box near an exhibit tank. To do this, point to a location near the tank wall -- preferably on a path, and then click to place the donation box.
null
Raise Tank Wall
The Raise Tank Wall tool increases tank wall height. Click the Raise Tank Wall button.
The circular blue cursor indicates the Raise Tank Wall tool is now active. Click the Check button to continue.
Raise Tank Wall
Place the circular blue cursor in the tank, and then click to raise the tank walls a level. Click and hold if you want to continue raising the height of the tank walls.

The Lower Tank Wall button works much the same. There's also another way to raise and lower tank walls -- pointing to the top of a tank wall, then when the cursor displays as a hand, clicking and holding to drag the tank walls up or down. Click the Check button to continue.
Lower Tank Floor
Let's make your tank a bit deeper. Click the Lower Tank Floor button.
null
Lower Tank Floor

The Lower Tank Floor tool works like the Raise Tank Wall tool. Place the circular blue cursor in the tank, and then click to lower the tank floor, increasing the tank's depth. Click and hold to continue lowering the tank floor.
You can also raise tank floors, decreasing a tank's depth. The Raise Tank Floor tool works just like the Lower Tank Floor tool. Click the Check button to continue.
Landscaping

When you first place a tank, the tank's water uses the biome of the terrain on which the tank is placed. Since this tank was built on grassland, the water inside is grasslands water. Let's change it to the reef biome, so we can put a manta ray in the tank. Click the Landscaping tab.
Deep Water
The reef biome has already been selected for you. Click the Deep Water button, and then click the water in the tank.

Well done! You filled the tank with warm reef water. The reef biome is one of four new biomes in Marine Mania. The other new biomes are benthic, coastal, and pelagic. Click the Check button to continue.
Decorating the Tank
Let's make the tank more welcoming to a manta ray! Click the Plants tab.
null
Select Blue Green Coral
We're going to add blue green coral to the tank! Click the blue green coral icon, and then place three blue green coral inside the tank.
Good job! Did you know that corals are animals, not plants? They are related to jellyfish and sea anemones. Click the Check button to continue.
Animals Button
Later, you can add more coral, reef rocks, and other decorations to your tank. Right now, let's add a manta ray! Click the Animals button.
null
Manta Ray
Click the manta ray, and then place it in your tank.
Outstanding! Next, let's add a water filter, and then you're done. Click the Check button to continue.
Construction Panel
Water filters are extremely important. They keep your tanks clean and your animals healthy. Click the Construction button.
null
Tank Building
Click the Tank Building tab.
The water filter cleans the water, preventing the tank from becoming dirty. Click the Check button to continue.
Show and Tank Objects
Now click the Show and Tank Objects tab.
Some of the items here are only used in shows, but the water filter can be used on any tank. Click the check button to continue.
Water Filter
Click the water filter, and then place it just outside your tank, next to a tank wall. Note that you can only place the water filter next to water or a tank wall.
Great! Since water filters can break, you need to maintain them either by hiring a maintenance worker or doing it yourself in First Person mode.

Congratulations, you completed the basic tank construction tutorial! Now you can dive in and start building tanks.
Click the Check button to play the next tutorial. You're ready to learn about advanced tank construction.
Click the X button to return to the main menu.
That tank is too small! Make it large enough to fill the rectangle of dirt.
That tank is not complete! Make sure it has four unbroken tank walls.
Beaky
Welcome! In this tutorial, you learn advanced techniques in tank construction to create an exhibit that combines a tank with land. When you're ready to start, click the Check button.
Hybrid Tanks

There are two different ways to construct a hybrid tank -- a tank that combines tank walls with a land exhibit. Hybrid tanks are perfect for animals that live both on land and in water. Click the Check button to continue.
For example, there is a polar bear exhibit in this zoo that is a hybrid tank. Now you're going to build something like it! Click the Check button to continue.
Coastal Exhibit
In the middle of the zoo is an empty coastal exhibit. There's a popcorn stand in front of it. Scroll over to the coastal exhibit now.
Let's transform this empty coastal exhibit into a hybrid tank. Click the Check button to continue.
Landscaping
We're going to paint some coastal water inside the coastal exhibit. Click the Landscaping button.
null
Deep Water
The coastal biome has already been selected for you. Paint coastal deep water over the rocks inside the coastal exhibit. Keep painting until you've sunk every rock in deep water.
Good work! Next, let's add a lowered viewing area, giving guests a better view inside the tank. Click the Check button to continue.
Habitat Editor Tools
Click the Habitat Editor Tools tab.
null
Create Valley

We're going to lower the ground in front of the tank to give guests an underwater view. Click the Create Valley tool, then paint a valley along the path just outside the tank wall. Lower the area from the popcorn stand to the donation box. The polar bear exhibit is an example of what you're trying to make.

You did it! This would the perfect exhibit for California sea lions. There are still a few small details that need work, like smoothing out the path, but let's move on. Click the Check button to continue.
Pelagic Tank
Let's learn another, even easier, way to make a hybrid tank. Find the pelagic tank next to the coastal exhibit -- it's the one with leatherback sea turtles in it. Scroll over to the pelagic tank now.

At the back of the pelagic tank is a fenced area with a treasure chest. We're going to combine the fenced area and the pelagic tank to create a hybrid tank. You can do it in one step! Click the Check button to continue.
Pull Down Tank Wall

Place your cursor on top of the back tank wall -- the tank wall nearest the treasure chest. When the cursor becomes a hand icon, press and hold the SHIFT key. Then click and drag the tank wall in a downward direction.
Using the SHIFT key this way lets you lower just one tank wall to give the animals access to both the water and land areas of the exhibit. You just created a hybrid tank!

Congratulations, you completed the advanced building techniques tutorial! Now you can experiment with and create cool hybrid tank combinations.
Click the Check button to play the next tutorial. You're ready to learn how to train marine animals to perform tricks.
Click the X button to return to the main menu.
Welcome! In this tutorial, you learn two different ways to train marine animals to do tricks, which guests love to watch. When you're ready to start, click the Check button.
Training Animals
In Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania, you can train certain marine animals to perform trained behaviors, or tricks, which can then be performed at marine shows. Click the Check button to continue.

You can train animals in any tank with a tank entrance and a training area. Not all marine animals can be trained -- you can't train a great white shark! Dolphins, though, are quick learners and do all sorts of tricks. Let's teach the bottlenose dolphin in this tank the Jump trick. Click the Check button to continue.
Select Dolphin
Find Beaky, a bottlenose dolphin, in the tank. Click Beaky to select him.
Awesome! When you select an animal, the Animal Information panel appears in the lower right corner of your screen. Click the Check button to continue.
Train Animal
Click the Train In 1st Person button. When a training area appears on your cursor, point to the spot in Beaky's tank where you want the training area to go, and then click to place it.

Training areas are required to teach tricks. If a training area isn't already in the tank when you click the Train In 1st Person button, you are automatically prompted to place one. Click the Check button to continue.
Place Training Area
Click in Beaky's tank to place the training area.

The Train Animal panel opens automatically whenever you add a training area. The Train Animal panel displays all the tricks that animal can learn. Each trick has a training level, indicating how well-trained that animal is on particular tricks. Right now, Beaky doesn't know any tricks, but you'll change that! Click the Check button to continue.
Jump in Trick Area

The Train Animal panel shows the tricks that animal can learn. The training level shows how well the animal knows each trick. Right now, Beaky doesn't know much about any of the tricks. Let's teach him one! Click the Jump in Trick Area button to enter Training mode.
In Training mode, you use the training wand to train animals. You do this by tracing a gesture, or movement, with the training wand. Click the Check button to continue.
Tracing Gestures

In animal training, the tracer moves along a gesture line. The tracer is a ring with an arrow attached. It's located to the left of the gesture line. The gesture line is the large yellow line that curves in front of you. Your task is to keep the training wand over the tracer as it moves along the gesture line. Click the Check button to continue.

Occasionally, you need to press special keys while tracing a gesture. In this trick, you need to click at the top of the curve. Other tricks, for example, require you to press one of the ARROW keys. Click the Check button to continue.
Begin Training
When you're ready, click the Check button to close this window, and then click the tracer to start training.
Reward Dolphin
Press SPACEBAR to reward Beaky with a fish.

A few things to remember about tricks and training: Animals don't actually learn anything until you reward them. The higher an animal's trick score, the more it learns. As an animal's training level in a trick increases, it performs that trick better. When an animal masters a trick, it may unlock new tricks. Click the Check button to continue.
Jump in Trick Area
Let's try the same trick again, so we can learn a few advanced techniques. Click the Jump in Trick Area button to enter Training mode.

This time keep a close eye on the tracer as it moves. Notice how little sparks shoot from the tracer? Pay attention to the color of the sparks. Green sparks indicate you're doing well. Yellow and orange sparks indicate you're falling behind a bit. Red sparks indicate you're not earning any points because your training wand is too far away from the tracer. Click the Check button to continue.
Begin Training
To return to training, click the Check button to close this window, and then click the tracer.
Reward Dolphin
Good work! Press SPACEBAR to reward Beaky with a fish.

The more you train an animal on a trick, the better it gets. The better an animal is at a trick, the harder it becomes to further train that trick. Each trick has three levels of training difficulty. As you move from one difficulty level to the next, you may notice that the tracer moves faster, that there are more keys to press, or that a gesture's shape changes. Click the Check button to continue.
Close Train Animal Panel
While it's fun to train your own animals, you can also hire trainers to train them for you. Let's learn how to use trainers. First, close the Train Animal panel.
null
Staff
Trainers are a type of staff member, like zookeepers and educators. Click the Staff button to open the Staff panel.
null
Place Trainer
Click the trainer icon, and then click anywhere in your zoo to place a trainer.

Trainers function like zookeepers in some ways. A trainer without any special assignments automatically seeks out marine animals to train. Trainers can only train marine animals that are able to learn tricks. The animal must also be happy before a trainer can train it. Click the Check button to continue.
Select Trainer
You can also assign a trainer to work with one or more specific animals. To do this, first click the trainer you want to assign.
null
Training Assignments Tab
Next, click the Training Assignments tab.
This panel allows you to choose the animals you want to assign to the selected trainer. Click the Check button to continue.
Add New Assignment
Click the Add New Assignment button to activate the training assignment cursor.
null
Select Dolphin
Now click Beaky using the training assignment cursor.
Well done! Beaky's name now appears on the assignment list and the trainer you selected is assigned to train Beaky. Click the Check button to continue.
Trainer's Training Panel

Once an animal is assigned to the trainer you have the option of telling the trainer which specific tricks to teach that animal. Click the button next to Beaky's name on the assignment list to open the Training panel.

This panel lets you specify which tricks you want Beaky to learn. A check mark next to a trick icon indicates you assigned the trainer to teach that trick. If all the tricks are checked, the trainer teaches all of them to the animal, starting with the easiest ones. Click the Check button on this window to continue.
Training Multiple Animals

You can assign a single trainer to train multiple animals in multiple tanks. Of course, the more animals you assign to a trainer the less time the trainer has with each animal. If you assign a trainer to teach animals in different tanks, don't forget that it takes time for the trainer to travel between them. Click the Check button to continue.
Trainers can only train animals in tanks that have a tank entrance (a platform with a ladder.) Click the Check button to continue.

Congratulations, you completed the animal training tutorial! Now you can take the plunge and train your marine animals in all sorts of tricks!
Click the Check button to play the next tutorial. You're ready to learn how to create marine shows that dazzle your guests.
Click the X button to return to the main menu.
Welcome! In this tutorial, you learn how to create and schedule marine shows. When you're ready to start, click the Check button.
Show Tanks

To create a marine show, you first need a show tank. A show tank is different from an exhibit tank in two respects. First, only a show tank uses a show platform. Second, although marine animals perform in show tanks, they can't live in them full time -- it's hard to eat or sleep when a show is happening in your house! Click the Check button to continue.

This zoo has three tanks. There's a bottlenose dolphin in one and an orca in another. The middle tank is empty, which makes it perfect for a show tank! After making a show tank, you can create marine shows featuring the dolphin and the orca. Click the Check button to continue.
Construction Panel
To create a show tank, you need to add a show platform to the middle tank. Click the Construction button to begin.
null
Show and Tank Objects
The show platform is located on the new Show and Tank Objects panel. Click the Show and Tank Objects tab.
null
Show Platform
Click the show platform icon, then point to the spot in the tank where you want it to go. Click to place the platform in the tank. Note that you can only place a show platform next to a tank wall.
The MC runs marine shows from the show platform. You also use the show platform to schedule marine shows. Click the Check button to continue.
Tank Portal

Whenever you add a show platform, you're automatically prompted to place tank portals. Tank portals let your animals travel from the exhibit tank, where they live, to the show tank, where they perform. You can only place tank portals on tank walls. Let's connect the the dolphin exhibit and the orca exhibit to the show tank. You already have a tank portal on your cursor, so just click the tank walls to place the portals.
Good work! Now the animals can swim to the show platform and perform. Click the Check button to continue.
Large Grandstand

Let's add a large grandstand, so guests can sit and enjoy your marine show. Place it in front of the show tank with the seats facing the tank. The space between the flower beds is a nice spot. Click the large grandstand, and then click the spot where you want it to go.
Brilliant! Click the Check button to continue.
Rotate the grandstand so that it faces the tank, then place it again
Landscaping
The show tank currently contains water from the grasslands biome. We need to change the biome of the water to another type, something both show animals like. Click the Landscaping tab.
null
Select Show Platform
Let's put on a show! To create a show, click the show platform in the show tank.
The Show Platform Information panel lets you edit, delete, and also order and reorder shows. First, though, you need to create a show. Click the Check button to continue.
Create Show
Click the Create Show button.

You should now see the Show Mixer. The Show Mixer lets an animal perform multiple tricks during a show. It also lets several animals perform tricks at the same time. We're going to create a simple show using the dolphin and the orca. Click the Check button to continue.
Add Animal
First, add the dolphin to the show. Click Add Animal, then select the bottlenose dolphin--and only the dolphin--from the list.
Note that the list only includes show animals in exhibit tanks with a tank portal connected to a show tank. Click the Check button to continue.
Add Animal
Let's have the orca perform in the show, too. Click Add Animal again, and then select the orca from the list.

Now that both animals are added to the show, let's assign tricks to them. For the show's first act, let's have the dolphin and the orca perform their tricks at the same time. Click the Check button to continue.
Add New Trick
To assign a trick to the bottlenose dolphin, click the dolphin's Add New Trick button, and then select a trick from the list.

Whenever you assign a trick to an animal, a trick area or show prop is automatically created. You can pick up the trick area or show prop and move it anywhere you want in the show tank. Click the Check button to continue.
Add New Trick
Now that you scheduled the dolphin's first trick, let's do the same for the orca. Click the orca's Add New Trick button, and then select a trick from the list.
When the show starts, the dolphin and the orca are set to perform their tricks at about the same time. Click the Check button to continue.
Add New Trick
For our second act, let's assign the dolphin another trick. Click the bottlenose dolphin's Add New Trick button, and then select a different trick from the list.
Note that you can name your show anything you like, especially if you find "Show 1" a bit boring. Click the Check button to continue.
Save and Exit
Click the Check button on the Show Mixer to save your show and exit the Show Mixer. The show platform automatically opens after you create a show.
There are just a couple more things to do, and then you can see your show! Click the Check button to continue.
Insert Break

Animals need to take a break from shows. If an animal spends too much time performing, it becomes unhappy, and unhappy animals refuse to perform. To keep the bottlenose dolphin and the orca happy, insert a break after the show. To do this, click the Insert Break button.

Now sit back and enjoy your show! Note that you can watch it from the grandstands while in Zoo Guest Mode. When the show platform is open, all scheduled shows run in the order created. When all the shows play, they start again and repeat in the same order. When you're done watching your show click the Check button to continue.
Disable Show

The Show Platform panel performs many important show activities. You use it to add new shows. You use it to edit, view, reorder, and delete existing shows. You also use it to temporarily disable a show. Click the Check button next to the name of the show we just created to temporarily disable it.

Good job! Guests rate shows using a star system -- the more they like a show, the more stars they give it. Guests donate to your zoo when they like your show, so be sure to put a donation box near each show tank. Note that the popularity of each trick changes over time. Try to schedule shows that feature popular tricks, and don't forget to update your shows as other tricks gain in popularity. Click the Check button to continue.

Congratulations, you completed the marine show tutorial! Now you can make some waves by creating truly amazing marine shows.
Click the Check button to play the next tutorial. You're ready to learn about some of the other new features in Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania.
Click the X button to return to the main menu.

Welcome! In this tutorial you learn about the Eyedropper tool, terrain feature filters, how to swim with dolphins, and other new features in Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania. When you're ready to start, click the Check button.
Landscaping
There are also some new ways to do things. For example, landscape features -- trees, plants, and rocks -- are painted differently. Click the Landscaping button to learn how the new way works.
The desert biome has already been selected for you. Click the Check button to continue.
Paint Landscape

Notice that the layout of the Landscaping panel is changed. You no longer paint in terrain features by selecting biome brushes at the bottom of the panel. Instead, our new terrain feature filters let you add trees, plants, and rocks as you paint in your landscape. To learn how they work, first click Sand, then paint down some sand inside the large dirt field surrounded by flower beds that's near the zoo entrance.
At the moment, all three terrain feature filters are off. When you paint down sand, you don't see any trees, plants, or rocks. Click the Check button to continue.
Rocks Filter
You can turn on all or any combination of the terrain filters. Simply click a terrain feature filter to activate it. Okay, you give it a try! Click the rocks filter to turn it on.
null
Paint Landscape
Well done! Now paint down some more sand.

Since the rocks filter is on, you paint in rocks while painting the desert landscape. Note that the terrain feature filters give you more precise control over what gets added or doesn't get added to your landscape. Click the Check button to continue.
Select Tree

Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania comes with a lot of cool new features, including the Eyedropper tool. The Eyedropper tool is a quick and easy way to place a copy of almost any object in the game. Let's use it on the balsam fir tree by the hamburger stand. Find the balsam fir tree then click it.
null
Eyedropper Tool
Click the Eyedropper tool. Notice that an exact copy of the balsam fir appears on your cursor. Point to where you want the tree to go, and then click to place it.

The Eyedropper tool doesn't work on all objects. In a campaign or scenario game, it does not work on objects for which you haven't acquired enough zoo fame. The Eyedropper tool also doesn't work on items requiring research that hasn't been done. Click the Check button to continue.
Select Manta Ray
There's also a similar way that lets you to copy animals. Find the manta ray tank, and then click a manta ray to select it.
null
Zookeeper Recommendations
Click the Zookeeper Recommendations button.
null
Copy Animal
On the Zookeeper Recommendations panel, click the manta ray icon. Drag the copy of the manta ray to the manta ray tank, and then click to place it.

This shortcut only works for animals on the Adoption panel. If an animal isn't currently listed on the Adoption panel, you won't be able to copy it in a scenario or challenge game. Click the Check button to continue.
Close Zookeeper Recommendations
Click the Zookeeper Recommendations button to close the Zookeeper Recommendations panel.
null
Zoo Quick Stats
Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania has a few new ways to gather data about your zoo. Click the Zoo Quick Stats button to open the Quick Stats panel.
There are two new tabs on the Quick Stats panel -- the Building Information tab and the Donation Box Information tab. Click the Check button to continue.
Building Information

The Buildings List gives you quick access to data on all the buildings in your zoo. You can see how long a building has been open, its total profit to date, and its average monthly profit. Click the Building Information tab to open the Buildings List.

As with the other lists on the Quick Stats panel, you can click a building's name to go right to it. The new Donation Box Information tab gives you quick access to data on all the donation boxes in your zoo. It works the same way as the Building Information tab. Click the Check button to continue.
Close Zoo Quick Stats
Click the X button on the Quick Stats panel to close it.
null
Select Dolphin

Swimming with bottlenose dolphins and other marine animals is one of Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania's most exciting new features. Let's swim with a dolphin! First, find the dolphin tank. Next, click a dolphin to select it.
The Swim With Animal feature lets you enter the bottlenose dolphin exhibit and swim with one of these magnificent animals. Click the Check button to continue.
Swim With Animal
Click the Swim With Animal button to swim alongside a bottlenose dolphin. Enjoy the ride!
Click the Check button when you're done swimming and want to continue the tutorial.
Swimming in Zoo Guest Mode

You know you can also swim in tanks and dive underwater in Zoo Guest Mode? It works much the same way as walking around your zoo in Zoo Guest Mode. (Note that if your mouse has a scroll wheel, you can use it to dive or ascend while you swim.) Click the Overhead View button to continue the tutorial.
You can even take photos while swimming underwater! Click the Check button to continue.
Improved Ball Physics

Here's one more fun feature -- improved object physics. These make the animals' toys and pursuit balls roll and bounce better than ever. To try it out, locate the circular pit surrounded by pursuit balls. It's near the back of the zoo. Drop some balls into the pit and watch how they roll. Try kicking the balls around in Zoo Guest Mode! When you're done, click the pirate ship in the sea lion exhibit to complete this tutorial.
null

Congratulations, you completed all the tutorials for Zoo Tycoon 2: Marine Mania! You're ready to create amazing zoos and thrilling marine shows. Be on the lookout for the 20 new animals, 20 new challenges, 2 new campaigns, and many new objects we added just for you. We hope you explore, experiment, and discover an ocean of fun!
Don't forget to play the other tutorials whenever you want to learn more about Zoo Tycoon 2. You can find them marked with the book icon.
Click the X button to return to the main menu.
Marine Mania Tutorials
Tutorial 1: Tank Construction Basics
Tank Construction Basics
Learn the basics of building an exhibit tank for marine animals.
Tutorial 2: Hybrid Tank Construction
Hybrid Tank Construction
Learn how to create hybrid exhibits that combine land and water.
Tutorial 3: Training Animals
Animal Training
Learn how to train show animals to perform tricks.
Tutorial 4: Creating Shows
Creating Shows
Learn how to create and schedule marine shows.
Tutorial 5: Marine Mania Features
Marine Mania Features
Learn about many of the game's new and improved features.
